page.title: 03THE MARKET OF A-IN-M.
page.content: The market is situated in the centre of Ashton. It is surrounded by shops. In the market they sell anything from small novelty items up to size 22 dresses. On Tuesdays and Saturdays when the market is on you will see gossipping old women propping up the nearest wall, and young girls and boys talking about the latest disco. Some of the stalls sell clothes, jewellery, make-up, food and material. You will see mothers trying to drag their young children away from the stalls. Just around the corner from the markets there are some cafes where busy shoppers go for a drink. The stalls are made of canvas held up with long metal poles and some are wooden huts plus a few caravans.
